title: All units of YTPS to be commissioned by January 15: Deputy CM
content: Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka hands over appointment letters to persons of families who gave up lands to the 4,000 MW power project

title: Bengaluru: Sections of double-decker flyover remain unfinished a year after opening of main stretch
content: The double-decker flyover, built by BMRCL at a cost of ₹449 crore, spans 5.12 km and was designed to ease bottlenecks at the Central Silk Board junction

title: Vacate unauthorized shops, godowns at APMC Yard by month-end, says samiti
content: Members have been agitating for the last 69 days demanding eviction of shops and godowns functioning in the yard without authorisation

title: BJP will get 25% vote share in Kerala local body elections, claims Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister says party has a robust base in the State and it will come up with a good performance in the Assembly elections next year

title: 71 boats to vie for glory in NTBR
content: The boats, including 21 chundan vallams, will participate in nine categories in the 71st edition of the Nehru Trophy Boat Race to be held on Punnamada Lake in Alappuzha on August 30.

title: TDP uses IVR survey to select mandal-level leaders in Naidu’s home turf
content: Automated calls in Kuppam constituency mark a shift from senior leaders’ recommendations to grassroots feedback, triggering both optimism and unease within the party

title: SWR introduces drone-based monitoring system to optimise loading efficiency at Ranjithpura station in Ballari district
content: According to SWR officials, this is a first-of-its-kind initiative within the zone, aimed at enhancing safety, efficiency, and accuracy in freight-handling.

title: Police book Girish Mattannavar and others for obstructing the arrest of Mahesh Shetty Thimarody
content: Brahmavar PSI told Belthangady police that Mattannavar and others, forming an unlawful assembly, attempted to prevent them from discharging duty.

title: Bengaluru stadium stampede: Chief Minister blames police, ‘mass hysteria’; refuses to apologise
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah lists over a dozen stampedes in BJP-ruled States from 2008 to 2025 and said 39 people died during the Kumbh Mela stampede alone at Prayagraj in Uttar Pradesh this January

title: IDSFFK 2025: Bedabrata Pain’s Deja Vu looks at farm protests from a fresh angle
content: The film looks at the impact of agricultural reforms in India following the historic protest of Indian farmers in 2020-21 and the impact of similar “market reforms” in the U.S. in the 1980s.

title: Andhra Pradesh government cutting down social welfare pensions, alleges YSRCP leader
content: Former MP says over 4 lakh old-age pensions removed in 14 months; terms re-verification drive politically motivated

title: How did you conclude there was no prima facie case against Ponmudy, Madras High Court asks T.N. Police
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar directs the police to submit the speech delivered by the former Minister as well as a 1972 reference that he had made

title: Chendamangalam handloom industry jolted by steep decline in weavers, keep fingers crossed during this Onam
content: From a peak of around 5,000 weavers and people in allied services in North Paravur taluk until the 1980s, the number has progressively declined to around 500 now

title: GST reforms will have serious impact on State finances: K.N. Balagopal
content: Kerala Finance Minister says he anticipates a dip of ₹8,000 crore to ₹9,000 crore in Kerala’s GST revenues. The revenue loss will be felt most in the automobile and insurance sectors, he says

title: NDA is jittery ahead of V-P polls as there is unease among Andhra, Telangana MPs: Raut
content: Are you (NDA) scared that there will be cross-voting?....there will be cross-voting by duplicate Shiv Sena (a reference to the Shiv Sena led by Eknath Shinde), says Sanjay Raut

title: Prime Minister Modi flags off three new metro links in Kolkata
content: With the commencement of new services today, a net total of 13.61 kilometres of metro connectivity was added across Green, Orange, and Yellow metro routes in Kolkata

title: Four minor boys escape from home, rescued at Manginapudi beach
content: CCTV footages help police to trace the children and reunite them with their families, says Patamata CI V. Pavan Kishore

title: Failed Rs 200 Payment For Abortion Pills Exposes Man's Extramarital Affair
content: A Chinese man's attempt to secretly purchase birth control pills backfired after his mobile payment failed, inadvertently exposing his extramarital affair to his wife.

title: FBI Raids Ex-US NSA John Bolton's Home Days After His Criticism Of Trump Tariffs
content: Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) agents raided the Maryland home of former US National Security Adviser John Bolton.

title: Bihar Chief Minister Promises 50,000 Jobs Before Elections, 1 Crore In 5 Years
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, while sharing the stage with Prime Minister Narendra Modi at Bodh Gaya, made significant announcements aimed at the youth and for the welfare of the people.

title: "Won't Be Scared, Defeated": Rekha Gupta's Strong Comeback After Attack
content: Chief Minister Rekha Gupta asserted that she will never be scared and defeated, and will continue to struggle for the rights of Delhi, as she resumed official engagements two days after the attack.

title: Police Questions 5 Persons In Gujarat Over Attack On Delhi Chief Minister
content: A team of Delhi police visited Rajkot city in Gujarat and questioned five persons associated with Rajesh Sakaria, a local resident arrested for allegedly attacking Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta.

title: Video: Stray Dog's Brutal Beatdown Of Leopard, Drags It 300 Metres
content: A stray dog and a leopard faced off in Maharashtra's Nashik. The 'fight' ended in the dog 'defeating' the leopard and dragging it for 300 metres. The episode unfolded in Nashik's Niphad and a video of the fight has gone viral on social media.

title: Pakistan Gears Up For Dhaka Rendezvous With Bangladesh Hardliners
content: India will be closely watching the developments in the neighbourhood this weekend as Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar are scheduled to be in Dhaka for a three-day visit.

title: Prisoner Escapes From Chhattisgarh Jail, Exposes Lapses In Security
content: The escape of a prisoner from Raipur Central Jail has triggered panic within the jail administration and exposed glaring lapses in its security arrangements.

title: "If Arvind Kejriwal Had Resigned...": Amit Shah On Bills To Sack Jailed Ministers
content: Amit Shah cited the example of Arvind Kejriwal, the former Delhi Chief Minister who ran the government from Tihar jail, to drive home the point of bringing in the bills to sack jailed ministers.

title: IAS Association Condemns "Personal Attacks" On Poll Body Chief's Family
content: The IAS association has come out strongly against the trolling of Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar's family online after allegations of 'vote theft' by Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi and other opposition leaders.

title: Travel Influencer's Viral Video Prompts Repairs On Mumbai-Goa Highway
content: The repair work on the Mumbai-Goa highway at the Vashishti Bridge is underway after an aerial video showed massive craters on the road. The footage was shared by a travel influencer.

title: Mamata Banerjee's "Nostalgic" Post As Kolkata Gets 3 New Metro Routes
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee went down the memory lane, revisiting her time as the Union Railway Minister, when she was involved in the planning and sanctioning of a series of Metro railway corridors in Kolkata.

title: "Should Haunt Us All": UN Confirms Famine In Gaza, 1st Ever In Middle East
content: The United Nations on Friday officially declared a famine in Gaza, the first in the Middle East, with its experts saying 500,000 people were facing "catastrophic" hunger.

title: Video: PM Modi Inaugurates Key Bridge In Bihar, Waves His Stole At Crowd
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a key bridge over the Ganga River in Bihar's Begusarai today.

title: Star Power, Mass Appeal: A Look At Actor Vijay's Political Impact
content: Actor-turned-politician Vijay's second major political conference has reignited debate on the kind of impact he could make in Tamil Nadu's 2026 Assembly elections.

title: These Apps Have Halted Real-Money Gaming Amid Crackdown On Online Betting
content: Several startups are pulling the plug on real-money gaming as the newly passed Online Gaming Bill, 2025, moves closer to becoming law.

title: 2 Images From 2 Political Eras: Rahul Gandhi In Bihar Recreates 1985 Pic
content: Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi's recent visit to a prominent mosque in the election-bound Bihar has recreated a photo that originally included his father and former prime minister Rajiv Gandhi.

title: How Climate Change Is Impacting Air Turbulence
content: For many flyers, air turbulence can be an unnerving experience -- and in a world warming under the effects of climate change, it is only set to worsen, according to a growing body of scientific evidence.

title: How You Can Help Sterilise Stray Dogs In Your Neighbourhood
content: The Supreme Court has revised its earlier directive on the relocation of stray dogs, saying that the animals should be sterilised, vaccinated and returned to their original neighbourhoods unless they are rabid or display aggressive behaviour.

title: How Sikkim Cracked Down On Online Gaming Much Before Centre Brought A Bill
content: Sikkim has been a frontrunner in cracking down on online gaming, said a senior official, explaining how the Himalayan state tucked in one corner of the northeast has played a key role in drafting the centre's latest Online Gaming Bill, 2025.

title: Bengaluru city civil court receives hoax bomb threat
content: According to a police officer, the email content was not related to Bengaluru but to caste issues in a political party in Tamil Nadu

title: RBI ED Indranil Bhattacharyya nominated as MPC member
content: The Board also assessed the emerging global and domestic economic landscape, including the geopolitical and financial market developments and associated challenges, the RBI said in a statement

title: Joint survey in Yadgir to assess crop damage due to rain in Karnataka
content: Officials of the Agriculture, Horticulture and Revenue departments began the joint survey on August 21 following some respite from rain

title: A.P. Minister Narayana inspects Kondaveeti Vagu, blames mismanagement for flooding
content: Under the West Bypass Bridge, the stream should have had a 25-foot-deep flow channel, but it was completely silted up, as a result, rainwater backed up, causing temporary flooding, the Minister explained

title: Arts and culture that shaped Chennai: a package
content: This is a compilation of a seven-part series in The Hindu on the arts and culture that have shaped Chennai, as part of Madras Day celebration

title: KSRTC to operate 1,500 special buses for Gowri-Ganesha festival in Karnataka
content: The special services will run between August 25 and 26 for outbound passengers, while return services are scheduled on August 27 and August 31

title: Folk artistes organize rally on the occasion of World Folklore Day
content: Artistes of various folk arts such as Tappetagullu, Gangireddulu, Jamukulapata, Chekka Bhajana, Burrakatha, Kolatam and others took out a rally from fort junction to old bus stand of Vizianagaram

title: Illegal quarrying in Maharashtra’s Ambernath goes unchecked for over a decade
content: Environmentalists and residents raise alarm over ecological damage, safety hazards and massive revenue losses

title: Actor Madhav Suresh, son of Union Minister Suresh Gopi, briefly detained after road rage incident in Kerala
content: Madhav Suresh was taken into custody following the incident in Thiruvananthapuram that involved a Congress leader. Police said the confrontation began when the vehicles driven by the actor and KPCC member Vinod Krishna blocked each other while the latter attempted a U-turn

title: Indian envoy discusses bilateral trade, energy security with U.S. lawmakers amid tariff tensions
content: The Indian Ambassador met Senator Bill Hagerty and thanked him for “consistent and strong support to the India-U.S. partnership.”

title: Search operation under way in Jammu & Kashmir's Kathua
content: “The search operation was launched in Juthalba area of Rajbagh after locals reported movement of two suspected persons in Jakhol area,” officials said

title: Palakkad MP V.K. Sreekandan hits out at Rahul Mamkootathil’s accusers and questions their ‘moral integrity’, later apologises
content: The Congress MP calls for investigation into political backdrop of scandalous allegations that led to Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil’s resignation as Youth Congress Kerala State president

title: Supreme Court refuses urgent listing of plea against mandatory registration of waqfs under UMEED portal
content: As per the mandate of the UMEED portal, details of all registered Waqf properties across India are to be mandatorily uploaded within six months

title: Iconic film shooting spots in Chennai: a package
content: This is a compilation of a seven-part series in The Hindu on popular movie shooting locations in Chennai city that have been immortalised on silver screen by the realm of cinema, as part of Madras Day celebration.

title: USAID didn’t receive funding of $21 million for voter turnout in India: Embassy to MEA
content: On February 28, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) requested the U.S. Embassy in New Delhi to “urgently furnish details” of expenditure incurred on all USAID-assisted or funded projects in India over the last ten years

title: West Bengal suspends four officials over alleged irregularities in revision of electoral rolls; no FIR filed
content: The suspensions came just a week after Chief Secretary Manoj Pant appeared before the EC in New Delhi, where he was allegedly given a deadline to suspend and initiate criminal proceedings against the officers by filing FIRs

title: Protest in Kerala’s Chalakudy over poor roads, traffic congestion leads to NHAI engineer being locked in room
content: Protest erupts after NHAI project director, who had earlier promised to attend the meeting, failed to show up

title: Supreme Court modifies earlier directive, allows release of strays from Delhi shelters after immunisation
content: A Bench led by Justice Vikram Nath expanded the ambit of the proceedings beyond Delhi-NCR to facilitate the formulation of a national policy on stray dog management

title: Former President Ram Nath Kovind to be chief guest at RSS’ ‘Vijayadashami’ event on October 2
content: The RSS said the event on October 2 will be held at Reshimbagh ground in Nagpur at 7.40 a.m. and will be addressed by its chief Mohan Bhagwat

title: Tribal man rescued after 6 days in captivity at Muthalamada resort in Kerala
content: Vellayan, 54, was found locked up in the resort building on Thursday night. Police said the resort owner had confined him to the room

title: Karnataka Assembly session: CM Siddaramaiah recalls 20 stampedes that happened in BJP-ruled states
content: The Karnataka CM spoke about the Prayagraj stampede during Kumbh Mela in January this year as well as the Gujarat Morbi bridge collapse in 2022.

title: Now corrupt people will go to jail, lose their positions as well; we’ll remove every infiltrator from our country: PM Modi in Bihar
content: Prime Minister inaugurates projects worth ₹12,992 crore while attacking the Opposition over corruption in Gaya rally

title: Anirudh’s concert in Chennai: Madras High Court directs organisers to strictly adhere to conditions imposed by police
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says, no fiasco like the one that occurred during A.R. Rahman’s Marakkuma Nenjam concert in 2023 should be repeated

title: Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee panel to probe allegations against Rahul Mamkootathil
content: KPCC disciplinary committee chairperson Thiruvanchoor Radhakrishnan says party’s national leadership will announce the composition of the inquiry panel

title: Second Godavari flood warning issued at Dowleswaram, Konaseema on alert
content: According to the Godavari Flood-2025 bulletin, the inflow of the flood level is above 13.30 lakh cusecs and 10,800 cusecs of them is being released into the canals in the Godavari delta

title: Bihar SIR row SC hearing updates: SC directs political parties to assist voters to file claims
content: The top court says voters can submit any of the 11 documents or Aadhaar with their claims, objections, applications for inclusion.

title: Will add voters extensively to win elections, says Kerala BJP vice-president B. Gopalakrishnan
content: Gopalakrishnan says the party will ‘bring people from even Jammu and Kashmir’ to emerge victorious in constituencies in which it has an advantage

title: Supreme Court restrains Assam Police from taking coercive action against journalist Siddharth Varadarajan, others
content: The top court protects senior journalists from sedition charges, highlighting concerns over “potentiality of abuse” under Section 152 of BNS

title: Stories of Chennai’s landmark statues: a package
content: This is a compilation of a seven-part series in The Hindu on the history of iconic statues in Chennai city, as part of Madras Day celebration.

title: BSF to hold talks with Border Guards Bangladesh from August 25 in Dhaka
content: Prevention of trans-border crimes, issues related to border infrastructure, among others, likely to be discussed

title: Man dies after inhaling toxic gas while cleaning restaurant waste pit in Kerala’s Palakkad
content: Sucheendran was called in by the restaurant owner to inspect a blocked drainage. As he climbed down into the waste pit using a ladder to examine the blockage, he reportedly began to feel discomfort

title: Authorities can take action against aggregators but should not harass individual bike taxi owners or drivers, says Karnataka High Court
content: The court gave this clarification when the A-G complained that aggregators had started offering bike taxis on their platforms even though the court had not given any such a liberty to them

title: Efforts on to end ‘doli’ woes of tribal population: Minister Gummadi Sandhya Rani
content: Gummadi Sandhya Rani said the government is making sincere efforts to improve the living standards of the tribal population

title: When Chai Met Toast’s new track, ‘Dreamland’ is an ode to Kerala
content: ‘Dreamland’ is the first track from the album Small Town Big Love, Little Homes, and features Job Kurian

title: Project Prayas: Sikkim’s Namchi Collectorate offers space for farmers, SHG members to sell their wares
content: Prayas was born from a simple idea: What if places of governance that generally record high footfall on working days can also serve as platforms for empowerment?

title: D.K. Shivakumar springs a surprise, sings RSS anthem in Karnataka Assembly
content: When the BJP sought his and Siddaramaiah’s resignation, the Deputy Chief Minister wondered if other Chief Ministers resigned after a stampede in their States.

title: Record demand for over 45 lakh saplings at Koppal Horticulture Fair
content: Ninth edition of the annual fair attracted over 10,000 farmers and visitors from Koppal and neighbouring districts

title: Odisha to appoint 45,000 primary school teachers over next three years
content: All students studying Class IX and X will be covered by free textbook supply programme, which as of now, was limited to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe students only

title: Karnataka High Court comes to aide of age-barred widow to get job on compassionate grounds in NWKRTC
content: The court considered it as a special case as Lakshmavva of Gadag, who had lost her husband who was employed in NWKRTC, had no means to earn a livelihood. The couple have no children, who could have been considered for appointment instead of her as she had crossed the age limit for the post.

title: Anganwadi workers stage protest against facial recognition system for ICDS beneficiaries in Kalaburagi
content: They argued that the FRS, which requires beneficiaries’ facial data to be scanned before distribution of foodgrains and nutritional supplements, violates the spirit of the National Food Security Act, 2013, whose core objective is to ensure that no individual goes hungry

title: Madras and the world: a package
content: This is a compilation of stories authored by writer and historian V. Sriram, published in The Hindu on August 22, 2025 on the occasion of the 387th Madras Day

title: Veteran Punjabi comedian Jaswinder Bhalla dies at 65
content: Renowned Punjabi actor Jaswinder Bhalla dies at 65 after brief illness, known for roles in popular Punjabi films

title: The link between Madras and the Far East
content: The history and legends of the Pallavas and Cholas would be incomplete without the mention of their exploits in the Far East. In this way, Madras and the Far East share a connection that spans centuries — something that has weathered the colonial era and has been thriving on multiple fronts in contemporary times

title: Red Sox in must-win mode? Are Yankees back? What you should -- and shouldn't -- believe in the American League
content: How big is this series with New York for Boston? Is Toronto the best team in the AL? We give verdicts on what it all means.

title: Beasley no longer target of gambling investigation
content: Malik Beasley is no longer a target of the federal gambling investigation conducted by the Eastern District of New York, his attorneys Steve Haney and Mike Schachter told ESPN on Friday, potentially reopening free agency for one of the NBA's top shooters.

title: Jones: Offer to Parsons was richest for non-QB
content: Jerry Jones said the agreement he believed he made with Micah Parsons would have been the richest ever for a non-quarterback, adding, "Nobody has ever offered him more money than I have to play football. Period."

title: Sources: Kimbrel to Astros on major league deal
content: Veteran reliever Craig Kimbrel will add a fresh arm to the Astros' ailing bullpen as they try to hold on to their lead in the AL West.

title: Anthony makes mark in Bronx debut with key HR
content: Rookie Roman Anthony hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning and drove in three runs in a memorable Yankee Stadium debut as the Red Sox notched a 6-3 victory over the Yankees in the opener of a 4-game series Thursday night.

title: SEC to go with 9-game schedule starting in '26
content: The SEC said Thursday that it will go with a nine-game conference football schedule starting in 2026.

title: Tomlin: Steelers DT Harmon has sprained knee
content: Steelers first-round pick Derrick Harmon was carted off the field after sustaining a knee injury in the team's final preseason game against the Carolina Panthers on Thursday night.

title: Red-hot Aces rout Mercury, push win streak to 9
content: Led by A'ja Wilson's 19 points and 13 boards, the Aces rolled to their ninth straight victory Thursday night with an 83-61 win over the Mercury.

title: Source: Eagles WR Wilson sidelined for season
content: Eagles wide receiver Johnny Wilson will undergo season-ending knee and ankle surgery, a league source confirmed.

title: 📺 Yankees' Costanza bobblehead draws crowds
content: The bobblehead coincides with the New York Yankees hosting "Seinfeld Night" against the Boston Red Sox.

title: Preseason report cards for every single rookie selected in the 2025 draft
content: How did Travis Hunter look in training camp? What's next for Tyler Shough? We checked in on all 32 NFL teams' rookie classes -- all 257 draft picks.

title: 'We are what we drive': How car dealers became college football's power brokers
content: More college football players are driving sports cars than ever before. But the connection between dealers and programs goes back decades.

title: Inside Arch Manning's wild recruitment saga
content: Getting the heir to football's QB dynasty to commit was destined to be crazy. But this was even beyond that.

title: LeBron, KD and an unprecedented next chapter in their 20-year rivalry
content: For two decades, the two superstars have led superteams to NBA glory. Now, for the first time, they're both looking up at one -- and perhaps the best one yet.

title: Who will make the 12-team College Football Playoff?
content: Select your favorite contender, make your picks and see what the Allstate Playoff Predictor foretells.

title: Which of the top-10 2025 recruits will play big roles? We have intel on each player
content: These formerly top-10 recruits are ready to start the season. Some will have bigger impacts than others.

title: Tough draft-day decisions: Can you pick a top-5 QB and top-3 TE and like your team?
content: Daniel Dopp shares takeaways from more than 100 drafts to help you make tough decisions in your upcoming drafts.

title: 'Dak's gotta be able to run': How will Prescott's hamstring affect his usage in 2025?
content: A hamstring avulsion ended Prescott's 2024 season in Week 9, but he's been pushing it this offseason.

title: The best worst transfers: Why the likes of Sancho, Werner were actually smart signings
content: Sometimes, a transfer should work out, but doesn't. Here are the best worst transfers over the past decade in the Premier League and beyond.

title: 10 European storylines to follow: Liverpool and City rebuild, Barca's defense, more
content: Even with predictable title races, each season has its own personality and plotlines. So here are 10 fun plots we're particularly interested in following across Europe as 2025-26 kicks into gear.

title: Reid's annual HBCU watch list: Ranking the top 10 prospects for the 2026 NFL draft
content: Ahead of Saturday's Cricket MEAC/SWAC Challenge Kickoff, we ranked 10 HBCU players who could be on next year's NFL draft radar.

title: Real or Not, WNBA playoff race edition: Who’s in, who’s out and which teams will host
content: Which teams might host? Could New York fall to the 4-seed? We examine the teams in the WNBA playoff hunt.

title: Vince Young's rise to college football legend began at Ohio State
content: Texas' 2005 title run started in Columbus, where Arch Manning and the Longhorns look to build a new legacy in '25.

title: How mid-major coaches are embracing -- or resisting -- being high-major launchpads
content: Some mid-major coaches lean into pitching their programs as a development step. Others are reluctant.

title: PLL quarterfinals preview: Key stats, matchups, how to watch
content: Which teams will advance to take on the Atlas and Outlaws in the next round? Here's what you need to know.

title: 'We saw how files were being signed from jail': PM Modi on bill to sack jailed PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated and laid the foundation for development projects worth Rs 13,000 crore in Gaya, Bihar, focusing on power, roads, urban infrastructure, health, and water supply. He flagged off the Amrit Bharat Express and Buddhist Circuit Train.

title: Enemy of my Enemy: Musk asked his rival to help him buy OpenAI: Who’s he?
content: Elon Musk approached Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to help finance his $97.4 billion OpenAI takeover bid in February 2025, court filings reveal. Despite their public feud, Musk sought Zuckerberg's investment to regain control of the AI company he co-founded with Sam Altman. Neither Zuckerberg nor Meta signed the letter of intent for the failed acquisition attempt.

title: J&K government sacks 2 employees over terror links; Article 311 invoked
content: Jammu and Kashmir's Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha terminated two government employees, Siyad Ahmad Khan and Khurshid Ahmad Rather, for alleged terror links. Investigations revealed their involvement in smuggling arms and narcotics for Lashkar-e-Taiba. Rather, a teacher, procured and distributed weapons, while Khan, an assistant stockman, sheltered terrorists and smuggled arms across the LoC.

title: 'It shows how rattled he is': BJP hits back at Lalu's 'pind-daan' remarks on PM's visit
content: BJP criticised RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav for his disrespectful remark towards PM Modi before his Bihar visit, labeling him as agitated. Yadav mocked Modi, suggesting he was coming to perform the 'Pind Daan' of Nitish Kumar's political career. BJP leaders retaliated, predicting the Mahagathbandhan's political demise in the upcoming elections.

title: The great education shift: Indian students eye Canada over US; what’s driving this?
content: Studying abroad offers unparalleled academic and cultural opportunities, but success requires more than intellectual ability. Students must cultivate skills such as cultural intelligence, advanced communication, critical thinking, digital literacy, emotional resilience, and networking. Mastering these competencies enables them to navigate diverse classrooms, engage meaningfully with peers, and emerge as globally competent, adaptable, and innovative individuals.

title: Jensen Huang in Taiwan: Nvidia CEO’s ‘main purpose’; H20 chip production may halt
content: Nvidia has reportedly halted production of its H20 AI chip following pressure from Beijing, which urged local companies to avoid using it. This decision comes amid rising tensions between the US and China over access to leading AI technology.

title: 'ECI stands totally exposed & discredited': Cong hails SC verdict on Bihar SIR
content: The Congress party has lauded the Supreme Court's decision regarding the Bihar Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, asserting that the Election Commission of India (ECI) has been discredited. The court directed the ECI to allow excluded voters to file claims online and offline, accepting Aadhaar as a valid ID.

title: 'No one above law': FBI raids ex-NSA John Bolton's house; outspoken critic of Trump
content: FBI agents raided John Bolton's home in Bethesda, Maryland, as part of a national security investigation ordered by FBI Director Kash Patel. The probe, involving classified documents, was initially launched years ago but suspended by the Biden administration. Bolton previously faced accusations of including classified information in his 2020 book.

title: 'Accept Aadhaar or any 11 docs': SC on Bihar SIR; why top court reprimanded parties
content: The Supreme Court has expressed concern over the limited involvement of political parties in rectifying voter deletions during Bihar's Special Intensive Revision. Despite the Election Commission adding 85,000 new voters, only two objections were filed by political parties.

title: Elon Musk teen prodigy quits after 2 years: Tech CEO respond; says ‘Never heard of him’
content: Elon Musk claims ignorance of Kairan Quazi's SpaceX departure, despite the 16-year-old prodigy's two-year tenure at the company. Quazi, who joined SpaceX at 14, is transitioning to Citadel Securities, citing a desire for faster-paced challenges in quantitative finance. He previously criticized LinkedIn for age-based restrictions, highlighting biases in opportunity gatekeeping.

title: Sachin Tendulkar beams with pride as Sara launches new business venture
content: The Tendulkar family is celebrating joyous occasions, with Sara Tendulkar launching her Pilates studio, a venture fueled by her passion for health and fitness. Sachin Tendulkar expressed immense pride in his daughter's independent endeavour, highlighting her dedication and the family's focus on well-being. This milestone follows Arjun Tendulkar's recent engagement to Saaniya Chandok, adding to the family's happiness.

title: South Africa outclass Australia, make it five ODI series wins on the trot
content: South Africa dominated Australia in ODIs, securing their fifth consecutive bilateral series win with an 84-run victory in Mackay. Defending 277, the Proteas capitalised on Australia's batting struggles, dismissing them for 193. Lungi Ngidi's five-wicket haul and strong batting performances from Matthew Breetzke and Tristan Stubbs sealed the series win for South Africa.

title: Matthew Stafford’s wife trolls him over papercut joke: 'The drama was real'
content: Matthew Stafford is back in practice for the Los Angeles Rams. He is recovering from a back injury. Stafford joked about a papercut. His wife, Kelly Stafford, joined in on the fun. Stafford is focused on getting healthy for the season. He aims to lead the Rams back to the playoffs.

title: 'Harmony, dignity': Rajnath on what world order under India's guidance will look like
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh advocated for a new world order guided by India, emphasizing responsibility and commitment to the global good. He highlighted India's economic rise and its potential to strengthen global supply chains as a viable alternative to China.

title: Days after attack: Ruckus at CM Rekha Gupta’s Delhi event; two detained
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta faced disruptions at a public event in Gandhi Nagar, where two men were escorted away by police after causing a disturbance. This incident follows an earlier assault on Gupta at her office, raising concerns about her security.

title: Amit Shah accuses INDIA's VP candidate Sudershan Reddy of supporting Naxalism
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticized the Congress-led India bloc's Vice President candidate, B. Sudershan Reddy, accusing him of supporting Naxalism through his Salwa Judum judgment. Shah claimed that this judgment delayed the end of Naxal terrorism and diminished Congress's chances in Kerala.

title: Matthew Breetzke breaks Navjot Singh Sidhu's 38-year-old record
content: South Africa batter Matthew Breetzke has made history by becoming the first ODI cricketer to begin his career with four consecutive scores of fifty or more. The South African batter achieved this milestone during the second ODI against Australia, scoring a fluent 88. India's Navjot Singh Sidhu had achieved the feat in 1987 but in five ODIs.

title: Dedicated feeding zones, vaccination & more: SC’s major order on stray dogs
content: The Supreme Court has modified its order regarding stray dogs. The court directs the Municipal Corporation of Delhi to release sterilised and vaccinated dogs back into their localities. Dogs with rabies or aggressive behaviour will be kept separate. Public feeding is prohibited, but designated feeding zones must be created. Animal lovers can adopt strays through the MCD.

title: China tragedy: Under construction brige collapses into Yellow river; 12 dead, 4 missing
content: A bridge under construction over the Yellow River in northwest China collapsed on Friday due to a steel cable failure, resulting in at least ten fatalities and four missing individuals. The incident occurred on the Sichuan–Qinghai Railway project, recognized as the world’s largest-span double-track continuous steel truss arch bridge.

title: UN declares famine in Gaza City; Israel dismisses claim as ‘Hamas lies’
content: The United Nations confirms famine in Gaza City. This marks the first official famine in the Middle East. The crisis may spread without a ceasefire and aid. UN aid chief Tom Fletcher says obstruction by Israel is the reason. Israel rejects the report, calling it false. The IPC uses strict criteria for famine classification.

title: 'So much respect': Suryakumar's wife backs Dhanashree over her reaction on divorce
content: Months after Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma's divorce, Suryakumar Yadav's wife, Devisha Shetty, has publicly supported Dhanashree. Following Dhanashree's emotional account on 'Humans of Bombay' about the overwhelming separation and media scrutiny, Devisha posted an Instagram story expressing her respect and love.

title: CBSE to launch nationwide anti-drug initiative in schools - Check details
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has joined forces with the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) to tackle substance abuse in schools nationwide. A Memorandum of Understanding will be signed on 3rd September 2025, followed by an Awareness Program for principals and counselors. The initiative will include workshops, counseling, and strategies to build drug-free school environments and empower students to make responsible choices.

title: 'Value of a human life should be more than sports': Ex-Indian cricketer
content: Manoj Tiwary questions the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match appropriateness after the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor, emphasizing human life's value over sports. He also expressed surprise over Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad, despite their strong performances.

title: 'Gates of hell will open': Israel's big warning to Hamas; cautions Gaza could be 'destroyed'
content: Israel's Defence Minister Israel Katz issued a warning. He said Gaza City faces destruction if Hamas rejects Israel's conditions. These conditions include the release of all hostages and disarmament. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu approved military action in the city. The Israeli military is contacting medical staff in northern Gaza. They are urging them to move south.

title: Offset breaks silence on split: Addresses divorce from Cardi B; reacts to her love life
content: Offset has addressed his divorce from Cardi B and her new relationship with Stefon Diggs, stating his new song "Move On" reflects a peaceful acceptance of the situation. He emphasizes closure and moving forward, describing their marriage as a closed chapter. These comments follow accusations of infidelity during their marriage, which neither Cardi B nor Offset have directly addressed.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 drops below 24,900; BSE Sensex down over 650 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went below 24,900, BSE Sensex ended almost 700 points down.

title: AI, but inclusive: IIT-B trains women in GenAI; IIT-R upskills cyber defenders
content: Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) are spearheading a movement to democratize AI education across India. Initiatives include empowering women with generative AI skills, fortifying cybersecurity readiness against AI-enabled threats, and making AI accessible across diverse disciplines. These efforts aim to cultivate a digitally skilled workforce, ensuring broad participation in India's AI-driven future.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Kolkata metro projects today: Routes, cost, airport link & more
content: Kolkata is poised for a major infrastructural upgrade as Prime Minister Modi inaugurates new metro lines and lays the foundation for an expressway. These projects will significantly reduce travel times, directly connect the city to the airport for the first time in decades, and enhance connectivity between key railway hubs.

title: Father kills 17-year-old daughter for rejecting arranged marriage; ends own life
content: In Hingoli district, a 45-year-old man allegedly murdered his 17-year-old daughter by smothering her with a pillow as she slept, after she refused an arranged marriage to a relative's son. Fearing social stigma, the man then died by suicide.

title: Sinhagad Fort mystery: Hyderabad youth missing, police launch probe
content: A young man from Hyderabad disappeared from Sinhagad fort. He was visiting with his fiancée and friends. He went missing near Tanaji Kada. His footwear was found near the cliff. Police are investigating the case. CCTV footage shows a person resembling him. Search operations are underway by police and rescue teams. The family is originally from Satara.

title: WBJEE result 2025 declared: Check direct link to download scorecard
content: The West Bengal Joint Entrance Examination Board (WBJEEB) has declared the WBJEE 2025 results today, August 22nd, following a delay due to court directives. Candidates can now access their rank cards and the final answer key on wbjeeb.nic.in and wbjeeb.in. This exam facilitates admissions to undergraduate engineering, pharmacy, and architecture programs.

title: ‘Payback time’: Shaquille O’Neal agrees to fight Charlie Mack
content: Shaquille O'Neal, the NBA legend, has accepted a celebrity boxing challenge from Charles “Charlie Mack” Alston, a music industry veteran. Alston's callout stemmed from a decades-old altercation, reigniting their feud. O'Neal responded with a mix of humor and threat, setting the stage for what could be a historic event in Celebrity Boxing.

title: Women's World Cup: Navi Mumbai replaces Bengaluru as venue - ICC issues revised schedule
content: The ICC has shifted the venue for the Women's Cricket World Cup, replacing Bengaluru with Navi Mumbai, which will now host up to five matches, including a semi-final and potentially the final. The tournament will span five venues across India and Sri Lanka from September 30 to November 2.

title: ‘Part and parcel’: Gauri Khan’s restaurant co-founder on flies, hair in food; sparks debate
content: Gauri Khan's restaurant faced controversy after its co-founder, Abhayraj Kohli, stated that finding a fly or hair in food is "part and parcel of doing work." This statement followed an earlier incident where the restaurant was accused of using fake paneer. Kohli defended the restaurant's hygiene standards, mentioning the use of a super freezer for raw meat storage.

title: Snoop Dogg sparks controversy: Rapper’s act ignites public debate
content: Snoop Dogg's recent remarks about same-sex families have ignited controversy just after the AFL defended his past homophobic comments, creating a significant issue. Simultaneously, Izak Rankine received a four-match ban for using a homophobic slur during a game. This situation casts doubt on the AFL's decision to feature Snoop Dogg at the Grand Final, especially given Rankine's suspension.

title: Domestic help caught urinating on utensils in Bijnor; arrested
content: In Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh, police arrested Samantra, a domestic help. She allegedly urinated on utensils while cleaning them at Satyam's house in Nagina. A video of the incident circulated widely on social media. Nagina Police Station's SHO, Sanjay Kumar, confirmed the arrest. A case has been registered, and investigations are ongoing. The incident has sparked outrage in the community.

title: 'Our babies got justice', rejoice animal activists after SC verdict on stray dogs
content: The Supreme Court has decreed that stray dogs, after undergoing sterilization, deworming, and vaccination, should be returned to their original localities, unless they exhibit aggressive behavior or are rabid. The court has also banned the street feeding of strays, instructing civic bodies to establish designated feeding zones. Animal welfare groups have expressed their support for the order.

title: ISRO Gaganyaan 2025: India’s first uncrewed G1 mission; Vyommitra robot launch in December
content: ISRO is preparing for the Gaganyaan G1 mission, an uncrewed test flight scheduled for December 2025, featuring the Vyommitra humanoid robot. This mission will validate critical technologies and safety protocols for future crewed flights. Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's ISS experience will inform the mission, highlighting the importance of international collaboration and rigorous testing to ensure astronaut safety and mission success.

title: 'Jaiswal is better than Shubman Gill': Ex India batter sparks selection debate
content: The selection of India's Asia Cup 2025 squad is creating controversy. Yashasvi Jaiswal is surprisingly left out. Shubman Gill makes a comeback to the T20I team. He is also appointed as the vice-captain. Experts are questioning Jaiswal's exclusion despite his strong performance. Sai Sudharsan's omission is also raising concerns. Subramaniam Badrinath highlights potential recency bias in the selection process.

title: Dharali flash flood: ISRO satellite images show over 130 buildings damaged
content: Satellite images from NRSC reveal the extensive devastation in Dharali following the August 5 flash flood, highlighting the direct impact on over 130 buildings. The analysis confirms the wiping out of roads, plantations, and habitations, with significant destruction concentrated at the confluence of the Kheer Gad and Bhagirathi rivers. The imagery will be crucial for damage assessment and rehabilitation planning.

title: AFC South betting preview: Texans favored; will Colts, Jags, Titans beat expectations?
content: Is it the Texans' division to lose, or will another team step up? Here are all the odds for each team in the AFC South and our favorite bets.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs turn to Nkunku after Eze snub
content: Christopher Nkunku is among Tottenham Hotspur's alternatives to Eberechi Eze . Adam Wharton and Malick Fofana are on arsenal's radar . tEAMtalk are suggesting they are exploring a potential move for the 27-year-old .

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Johnny Walker vs. Zhang Mingyang
content: Zhang Mingyang has three first-round knockouts in his first three UFC bouts . his opponent, Johnny Walker , is the only other person in history to have won his first 3 fights by KO . the co-main event features two top-10 featherweights in ESPN's divisional rankings .

title: New York finally solved Minnesota -- what does it mean for the WNBA playoffs?
content: the Minnesota Lynx and New York Liberty won 85-75 on tuesday . they've played four games in a three-week span . new york coach Sandy Brondello says she wasn't thinking too much about playoffs .

title: USMNT countdown to the World Cup: Does McKennie have Juve future?

title: 2025 preseason College Football Playoff predictions
content: college football reporters predict the 12 schools that will make up the college football Playoff beginning in December . the odds are updated every week following that week's games . Ohio State won the inaugural 12-team bracket last season, despite starting as the no. 8 seed .

title: Ranking the best players from 1 to 100
content: a list of the top 10 college football players entering the season is no easy task . it requires a mix of information, reporting and assumptions . some choices are easy and some projections are nearly universally agreed upon . at least a few will be hisman Trophy contenders by season's end .

title: Matchup in Ireland is among the last for the Farmageddon football rivalry
content: Iowa State and Kansas State kick things off this year . the rural-rooted rivalry is getting a rare but well-deserved turn in the spotlight . it's a big 12 game with conference title and national playoff implications .

title: The best picks for each draft slot in Rounds 1 and 2 in 10-team leagues

title: 'I'm living proof': How Lucas Erceg is using his sobriety journey to inspire others
content: the softball field at Boonville Correctional Center has two fences . the first is a standard outfield fence stretching from foul line to foul line . it's a stark reminder that the field is, quite literally, a diamond in the rough .

title: The Eagles face challenges as they gear up to try and repeat
content: the Philadelphia Eagles' depth will help them overcome potential setbacks from injury . the defense is led by one of the best in the business in Vic Fangio . many of the impact players from that group are back, and all are considered ascending players .

title: The NFL Enjoyment Index: How fun is your team to watch? We ranked all 32
content: ranked all 32 teams on watchability, which is different from overall goodness . overall goodness is about managing game state, sustaining drives, controlling the ball . watchability is about throwing the ball over them mountains, avoiding turnovers and setting up shot plays .
